sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. Suppose through the mid point O of side LM of a 
parallelogram JKLM , the line KO is drawn intersecting JL at P and JM 
produced in N . Prove that \(NP = 2KP \).


\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "In triangles KOL and NOM , we have 
\[
	OL = OM 
\]
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}\input[s1v3]{} = \angle MNO 
\]
\[
	\angle KOL = \angle NOM 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, by angle side angle rule, we can say that these two triangles are congruent.
\[
	\Rightarrow \Delta KOL \cong \Delta NOM 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
So, we can write
\[
	\Rightarrow \input[s3v1]{}\input[s3v2]{} = MN 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
Also, we have \input[s4v1]{} \input[s4v2]{} = KL $
\[
	\Rightarrow JN = JM + MN = KL + KL 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow JN = \input[s4v3]{} KL 
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
Now, in triangles JNP and LKP , we have 
\[
	\angle \input[s5v1]{} \input[s5v2]{} \input[s5v3]{} = \angle LKP 
\]
\[
	\angle JPN = \angle LPK 
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write 
\[
	\Delta JNP \sim \Delta LKP 
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
So, now we can write
\[
	\frac{NP }{KP } = \frac{JN }{KL }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{NP }{KP } = \input[s7v1]{} 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow NP = 2\input[s7v2]{} \input[s7v3]{} 
\]"}, {"id": "s8", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
hence proved.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["L", "K", "O"], "text": "$$\text{In triangles KOL and NOM , we have 
$OL = OM$, {given}, 
$\angle LKO = \angle MNO${alternate interior angles}, and $\angle KOL = \angle NOM${as they are vertically opposite angles}.}$$
"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": ["K", "L"], "text": "$$\{Since, corresponding sides of two congruent triangles are equal, therefore, $KL = MN $}$$"}, {"data": ["J", "M", 2], "text": "$$\text{Since, $ JM = KL${as opposite sides of a parallelogram are equal}, therefore, substituting values, we get $JN = 2KL $}$$"}, {"data": ["J", "N", "P"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle JNP = \angle LKP$ {alternate interior angles}, and $\angle JPN = \angle LPK${vertically opposite angles}}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [2, "K", "P"], "text": "$$\text{As the ratio of corresponding sides for similar triangles is equal, therefore, $\frac{NP }{KP } = \frac{JN }{KL }$, and on further simplification, we get $NP = 2KP $}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
